Reviews.Title: Good HDTV, Mediocre PC Monitor
Reviews.Author: T. Lin "rlin83"
Reviews.Content: I am looking for a small HDTV so I can use it as a secondary monitor - this one suit my purpose considering I only paid $199 for it.PLUS- Very good HDTV picture quality - I connect it to my cable and the tuner is smart enough to pickup all ANALOG and UNSCRAMBLED HD channels automatically. Overall HD picture quality is good.- It has one VGA, one HDMI, one component video, one S-Video and one composite video input - pretty good for a cheap TV.- NO NEED FOR AC ADAPTER!! The power supply is built-into the TV cabinet.- Sleep TimerMINUS- Not very bright at all- Limited vertical viewing angle- Limted tilt; does not swivel from side to side- Anemic sounding speakers / slightly better after I adjust bass/treble- Mediocre picture quality as a PC monitorOverall, for $199 don't expect it to perform like a Sharp or a SONY but I give it 4 star based on its sheer value and it's HDTV picture quality. It's a nice addition as a second monitor because you can also use it as a HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture, sound not so great
Reviews.Author: chudjr
Reviews.Content: We have small televisions in our office.  We have about 15 Sharp Aquos tv's that we are very happy with, but Sharp stopped making the smaller screens.  There are really not that many options for small screen tv's.  I read the reviews on the Viewsonic and at first was hesitant, but decided to try one.  The picture is very good and since we watch them sitting at a desk, there is no problem with the viewing angle.  The sound is not very good, but acceptable for our purpose.  I would not recommend this tv for home use unless in low volume situations or use with external speakers as the other reviewer mentioned.

Reviews.Title: Not what we expected
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Cash
Reviews.Content: Got the N1630w 15-inch TV for the kitchen counter, but will need to find another use for it because the speakers are totally tinny, even with full bass and treble added, or different sound preferences selected (I think Viewsonic expects you to add external speakers to this unit so the sound is as good as the picture).  Unit also sits very low to the countertop, and doesn't have a swivel feature to allow it to be tilted upwards.  The viewing angle is critical .. like viewing a projection TV .. you must look straight into this screen or the picture washes out.  We propped a dish towel under the front of the stand in order to have the screen looking up at us ... why no swivel, Viewsonic?  It won't be good for computers for the same reason it doesn't swivel up-or-down.  Analog TV performance is also quite poor, but then we all need to get away from analog anyway.  Buy a 19-inch or larger as you can fit into your needs .. this TV is small in size, and performance.

Reviews.Title: Why can't they make  a TV with decent sound
Reviews.Author: Christopher Eliades
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after reading about the poor sound on the small Sharp. I should have waited for a review here. The sound is annoying (I found the music setting to be the least annoying for listening to voice). The picture must be viewed at eye level, as also noted in the first review. On a positive note it has all the inputs and outputs you would need.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: JQ
Reviews.Content: I've had this television for over 2 weeks and I love it; it was the only one that I could find that met my criteria; a QAM tuner, AND it had to sit on my desk and fit under an overhead cabinet in my home office (it made it by 1/16", whew!)The picture quality is very good, but as other reviewers have said, the viewing angle could be better. I watch it at eye level, straight on, about 3-4 feet away and it is super. If I stand up and walk around, the upper vertical angle lightens the pic, but still looks OK to me. I checked the lower angle and it darkens the display. Of course I wouldn't watch it that way, but if you were to have it on a high shelf, that could be a problem. If you are close to the TV, the Horizontal angle at eye level makes the picture have a negative type appearance when you stray too far to either side. This is similar to a 22" Vizio we have in the kitchen. Again, it works for me in my situation, but could be a distraction in other environments.Lastly, the sound! Yes, it is not really great; kinda reminds me of a Transistor radio I had in the 50's. I tried to live with it for awhile, but it got on my nerves (I'm rather picky). I did not want to return the TV, so I purchased a pair of inexpensive Logitec 120 speakers, hooked them up to the headphone jack, and I am now very pleased with the sound output. If you demand more, you could spring for more elaborate extension speakers.All in all, I would recommend this with the caveats mentioned above. I'm very happy with it and was well worth the cost! It gets 4 Stars only because of the sound quality!______________________Update: 12/2009I feel I need to downgrade my initial praise of this TV. All I said earlier is true, but after two months it began to develop pixilation and checker boarding on the QAM stations. I at first thought it was my cable company, but the 4 other sets I have with a QAM tuner were fine. I even moved this TV to other inputs and it had the same problem. I returned the TV for repair at my expense and it came back just the same, if not worse.I called ViewSonic again and was sent a replacement TV (probably a refurbished one); they paid and were very nice. It is just the same. I then bought new cables, got a signal booster and had the cable company come and check; still has intermittent problems on the QAM stations. I even went to AV forums to see if there was any clue.So, my thinking is that this TV has an inherent problem with the QAM side of the tuner. It will more then likely work for most folks, but not too well with my cable company. It has a great picture when it works, but when it doesn't, it is very, very annoying. I would put all the blame on the cable company, but as said, my other TVs work great. So, just my opinion-hope it is helpful to some.One last item; the headphone jack on the replacement TV does not power the extension speakers I purchased to overcome the poor sound. SIGH!

Reviews.Title: Keep Looking, this TV is not for you
Reviews.Author: Steven P. Carlson "scotchanyone"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews, but was hoping this was a time they were wrong.  Its hard to find a small TV.  Don't do it, don't buy this one.  The picture is great as long as you are sitting squarely in front of it exactly at eye level.  But if you are buying this for your kitchen or a small room and doing what most people would be doing ... moving around, this is horrible.  The slightest off angle viewing creates a washed out picture.And the sound is worse.  Tinny barely describes it and I haven't found a way to make it really acceptable.Oh, and all this only after waiting through a VERY long start up time where we get to view the three birds!Unless you have one of those very specific stationary uses where the users thought it was ok, move on.  This TV is not suited for use in kitchens and most home applications that folks are normally buying a small TV for.Please, Sharp, please bring back your small Aquos!

Reviews.Title: The little TV that could
Reviews.Author: PETER MCGOWAN
Reviews.Content: For starters, I've got no complaints about this TV.  The picture is great, the tuner is great (I don't use a Decoder box so this is key), it's got a HDMI input (I do use an Apple TV so this is key).I used a OmniMount PRO 12" ceiling mount to place the TV over my fridge in the kitchen, so the standard VESA mounts on the back were also something I needed.  The stand can be removed easily enough with a small screwdriver (I expected ViewSonic to provide a small snap on cover for the hole left behind on the bottom after removing the stand but there wasn't one (at least not in the box I received - this might bother some people.The setup menu's easy enough to deal with, I set it up to skip the duplicate analog channels so when I channel up and down I see the HD channel if it's available.  I tried labeling the channels but can't seem to get the labels to "stick".If sound quality is very important to you, I do recommend you purchase a supplementary set of speakers for it.  Like any small TV I've seen it sounds a bit "tinny" on it's own.  Thankfully there are plenty of computer speakers available which fit the bill, for example I used an Insignia NS-3006 setup that I picked up for under $50 and am delighted with the setup.  The TV helps out by muting it's own speakers when you use the headphones jack.Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Viewing angle, sound are problems
Reviews.Author: Watchdog
Reviews.Content: With the set on the counter top and looking straight at it while standing, the picture was good but it appeared faded when siting at the table about 12 feet away. (Vertical viewing angle issue). Also, volume needed to be turned up near the max.  Tinny sound.  Maybe it's a 1-star.  Returned it.  Too bad.  I miss the birds.

Reviews.Title: ViewSonic N1630w 16-Inch 720p LCD HDTV review
Reviews.Author: J. B. Bormann
Reviews.Content: I seldom if ever write reviews, but this will be an exception.  After extensive looking for a 16 x 9 aspect ratio small tv set which I could hang above my kitchen countertop and below the kitchen cabnets, I finally came to the conclusion that this was one of the "very" few which there was to choose from.For a lcd tv of this size, it is well endowed with neat features... inputs, such as HDMI, S video, etc.  The cost of this set is relative inexpensive ($176 from Amazon's dealer, "J&R;") and it is a nice looking unit.  Oh, did I also say that it is the only set of it's size catagory with the universal  "VESA" mounting capability on it's back side.It looks nice, has a great picture, and fits perfect.  So, why not five star rating?  The audio !!  It is simply not very good... in fact, the telephone actually has almost as good a sound quality.  Even setting the tone controls (in the menu), it still sounds like two tin cans with a string.Several other reviews spoke of this, and I must say that now that I own this set, I concur 100%.  If you are listening to voice it isnt "that bad", but dont say you were not warned that the sound is poor.  Yes, I'm keeping the set, cause it's a pefect fit with excellent picture, and, well.... I'll get use to the sound -- after all, it's only used when in the kitchen (when there is a football game on, and  you cant afford to miss a play).UPDATE:  COUPLE YEARS LATER  January 18, 2012View Sonics Customer Relations and Technical Service IS BAD.  Turned set on and got "Set Clock" screen.  Went to menu and set clock but set still wont allow me to get tv picture (I have sound).  Called tech support -- poor lady only knew to tell me what the instruction book said about settting clock (which I had read already).  Told me "your set must have a problem".  When asked about a second line of technical help she said "she was the final technical authority".  Called View Sonics Corp Office and was told they would check it for fee of $140  (you can buy them NEW on Amazon for less). What a waste to toss into trash can.GOING TO CHANGE MY BUSINESS TO SAMSUNG who has 19" almost same dimentions which will still fit under countertop.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Andrew Daniluk
Reviews.Content: I had to order a second unit. The first didn't pick up channels 7 and 10. The new unit works perfectly. Someone complained about sound being tinny. The unit lets you have several sound enviroments. You can easily eliminate the tinny sound.

Reviews.Title: OK for the price
Reviews.Author: JGinLA
Reviews.Content: I bought a big screen with a PIP that would not show my DirectTV. I use the ViewSonic as a PUP (Picture Under Picture) so it's just used a few minutes each day. It does OK. I do not have HD.My only gripe is the menu that takes up 75% of the picture while you are trying to adjust the picture. You can adjust transparency but the purple fog never goes away. How can I adjust the tint to get proper flesh tones when the menu obscures the faces behind a purple screen? Answer-Guess at it, turn the menu off and repeat. Next time just put a little slider adjustment across the bottom, get rid of the huge screen blocker.

Reviews.Title: ViewSonic N1630w Tin Can Sound
Reviews.Author: Bene
Reviews.Content: This is a nice TV except for one unforgiveable exception: Sound quality.Imagine a cheap portable transistor radio from the '70s. Then imagine listening to that sound quality from your TV for an hour or so. Unacceptable. I sent it back.BTW: Amazon has an exceptionally good return policy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent (for a small TV)
Reviews.Author: RosieAndMe
Reviews.Content: I fear others are comparing this TV to their $2,000 set, so sure the audio is not as good but I find it very good for such small speakers.  The picture is also excellent for a set of this size and the set has many bells and whistles.  One should go to the ViewSonic site and download their operating manual.  In 1949 I was installing and repairing TVs, we sure have come a long way.

Reviews.Title: Best $200 I ever spent!
Reviews.Author: John Laspisa "spisi"
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about this purchase after reading all these reviews but it was the perfect size for an undermount in my corner kitchen cabinet. I am amazed at the picture quality after hooking up to an HD cable box via HDMI cable. The sound, which I expected to be of low quality, is more than adequate for a kitchen. Total out of pocket was about $275 (bracket and HDMI cable). Best money I ever spent!

Reviews.Title: Not a good product
Reviews.Author: K&KS; "K&KS;"
Reviews.Content: I was hoping for more.  The picture was poor, particularly from an angle off dead center and the sound was weak and thin.  I returned it for a 19inch Samsung which is much better.

Reviews.Title: great for the money
Reviews.Author: mona fish "mona"
Reviews.Content: i love my little t.v. it is perfect for my kitchen the sound is fine and picture has no glare..i thought it was worth it.i returned a polariod that was more money and had a glare..i'm glad i did.

Reviews.Title: Need ipod speakers
Reviews.Author: Joseph E. Clinton
Reviews.Content: Great kitchen TV but speakers are tinny sounding and very disappointing.  Only speaker outlet for auxiliary speakers is headphone jack.  Problem solved with a set of ipod speakers I had laying around.  Addition of ipod speakers connected at headphone jack made this TV perfect for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: great picture... tinny speakers
Reviews.Author: Henry Owen
Reviews.Content: This TV is well priced and very versatile to connect.  The speaker inadequacies can easily be worked around by connecting to a good computer sound system.  The viewing angle is a bit restrictive at closer viewing distances but is not a serious drawback.  Overall, I am very well pleased with my purchase.  I especially like the size. It sits beside my 22" comp. monitor so I can multi-task.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Ethelee
Reviews.Content: For a small tv, it is very handy but you must be very close to see the picture.  Works for the spot I put it into.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: clara
Reviews.Content: I'm using TV in kitchen and mounted it on a taller swivel stand so I can view while cooking or sitting at kitchen table.  The sound is not that great but suffices for area I'm in.

Reviews.Title: Best feature is the price
Reviews.Author: OB2 "jeff"
Reviews.Content: This TV works fine, but does have limits. The viewing angle is more limited than others and the tiny speakers sound horrible and tinny.

Reviews.Title: Satisfactory, but beware
Reviews.Author: Sharing Cheryl
Reviews.Content: Tv is perfect size for shelf, but tv has to be on same level as the viewer's eyes or below the viewer in order to get a picture that is bright enough.  Otherwise, the picture is very dark, almost like watching shadows.  I had the tv on  a shelf on my wall unit and had to move it down to the level of my kitchen table, so that the picture was bright and clear.  The sound is very tinny and needs speakers, but it is easy to install and is the right price.

Reviews.Title: Good small TV for our kitchen
Reviews.Author: Dennis W. Simpson "Dennis"
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a TV for the kitchen.  It had to be low profile so it would fit under a cabinet.  I wanted high definition capable, but I wanted standard definition capable, too.I paired it with a DirectTV standard definition satellite receiver box in an "expanded mode", since this TV is wide screen format. This works well. The units appearance is nice and sleek.The speakers are not very satisfying, but then the unit is expensive and the speakers are small.  I compensated by buying an inexpensive small set of powered computer speakers for the TV, and the combination is great.

Reviews.Title: Beware!
Reviews.Author: H. Schwarz
Reviews.Content: Beware, the TV tuner does not work well, good signals are not found, others are found then drop out later rendering it unwatchable. It was very frustrating. (BTW my other ATSC TVs with longer cable runs work just fine).  Viewsonic definitely went cheap on the ATSC tuner and it shows.  The angle view of the picture is terrible too (if mounted up).  I've now hooked this TV up to a DirecTV HD box and it works OK... although I did have a problem with an HDMI cable or connector, not sure if it was the TV's problem or the cable.  I am a techie and this TV has created the most frustration and disappointment ever. I bought this one for the size issue in my kitchen... big mistake.  I would not buy this TV again.

Reviews.Title: Worse viewing angle of any flat screen tv!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "senior sci-fi connoisseur"
Reviews.Content: I needed a small size flat panel HDTV to mount on my treadmill, and this was the only 16x9 HDTV that I could find in this size.It appeared to be a very nice looking, typical flat panel, and fit the space on the treadmill like it was made for it. I first noticed that the sound was "tinny", but could be made slightly more acceptable by using one of the sound options offered on the menu....But the real failing point on this model is the pitiful viewing angle...not just from the side (which is irrelevant on a treadmill), but the acceptable vertical range was only a few degrees! Even the slight up and down of your head while running caused a "dark/Light" alternating picture that is the worst I've ever seen...much worse than the older 4x3 tv that used to reside there, and it proceeded to give me a bad case of buyers remorse.

Reviews.Title: off center viewing poor
Reviews.Author: J. Noble
Reviews.Content: previous purchase of Sharp 32" LCD tv is great This ViewSonic 16" cannot be viewed from below or to the side of the screen or the picture darkens and displays deep shadows. would not purchase any small screen again.

Reviews.Title: Electronics opinion and observations
Reviews.Author: Electrons fan "Arnie"
Reviews.Content: I ordered and received my ViewSonic  16 inch t.v. about a month ago. The t.v. was shipped in a timely manner and was intact and in working order when I received it. The set up and operation is fairly straightforward. The picture is good as long as you don't get too far to either side . The speaker quality is o.k. for voice reception but leaves much to be desired for music. The best feature is its relatively small size. This is the first LED t.v. I have owned and my experience is with analog cathode tube t.v.s.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Pat McGoin
Reviews.Content: The sound is less than average for a TV. Most importantly, the picture is complete crap unless you look directly at the screen.  So, if you have to look up or down at the monitor the picture REALLY stinks.  If you are going to look at it straight on it is only OK.  It is fairly easy to set up.  The remote is fine.  Over all, it is a throw away TV at best.

Reviews.Title: Quaility TV-Moniter
Reviews.Author: JCJ
Reviews.Content: The Viewsonic Model N1630w, that I received quickly from Amazon, is very impressive.  The picture is superb hooked up to regular cable and the sound is very impressive for a small tv. I appreciate the quality appearance and engineering.  The size of this tv makes it very versatile. I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: ViewsSonic N1630W 16 inch 720p HDTV
Reviews.Author: Richard W. Chase
Reviews.Content: A great little HDTV mounted under cabinets in our kitchen. Excellent picture within a somewhat narrow viewing range. I recommend the addition of a set of amplified multimedia speakers to be used in lieu of the less than adequate internal sound system.  Otherwise, a great set for the money.

Reviews.Title: flat screen TV
Reviews.Author: F. Mandell "wanderluster"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, clear and sharp. Great TV for kitchen, bedroom, wherever. Very light, has hookups for anything you might want to add on. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kitchen TV
Reviews.Author: bjddjd
Reviews.Content: Like the product as a Kitchen TV.  Very good picture if looking straight on but degrades based on angle.  Sound could be better.

Reviews.Title: Review of View Sonic 16" LCD TV.
Reviews.Author: Henry L. Asmussen
Reviews.Content: I need to install an outside antenna to improve receiption. The TV was not hard to install and start up. The size is just for the location we selected.

Reviews.Title: Viewsonic TV
Reviews.Author: M. J. Meyer
Reviews.Content: As expected - nice small TV - simple set up. Good picture.  Sound could be better but not disappointed because I read that in another review - pretty typical of small TV's.

Reviews.Title: Kitchen TV
Reviews.Author: Lundy
Reviews.Content: Nice little TV! We got it for our kitchen and it has a great picture. The volume is a little weak, but I suspect that goes with all small TV's.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: PonyBoy TwoFeathers "PonyBoy"
Reviews.Content: I've had this now for a few years and it's still going strong the only issue i have is sound quality but i notice that any new tv the audio stinks. people don't know what real sound is anymore. tiny speakers just don't work. but other then that I love it I just hook it to my home theater system and play the audio through that. I would recommend this to anyone who has a small space and just wants a small t.v.

Reviews.Title: Excellent PC Monitor cum TV
Reviews.Author: John Doe
Reviews.Content: I bought this little beauty almost three years ago and am still using it as a PC monitor and as a TV, going strong like it was new. Nothing has gone wrong. Definitely recommend it. :-)

Reviews.Title: love it !!!
Reviews.Author: K. H. Crosskey
Reviews.Content: Wanted something for the kitchen, this is perfect size, and the picture is amazing! very clear. Highly recommend it for small spaces.

Reviews.Title: Remote stopped working after 3 months
Reviews.Author: A. Carter
Reviews.Content: Bought this product in December 2011 to replace the old, too-big analog set in my home office. Image, color, and sound quality are good enough on this new tv but not outstanding. Bought for size and price, so did not expect much. Good thing, 'cause the sensor on the remote failed last week. Manual controls work fine until the replacement comes. I had to buy it, of course, because ViewSonic  ignored my request for a replacement. This tv was discounted deeply, so what's another thirty bucks, eh? All I know is that my big ole 1997 Panasonic TV/VCR uses its original remote that periodically gets dropped, comes apart in four pieces, gets slapped back together, and keeps on working year after year. When the time comes to replace that poor old workhorse (soon), it won't be a ViewSonic.

Reviews.Title: ViewSonic TV
Reviews.Author: ReviewManic
Reviews.Content: Excellent price and fits in the small area I needed it to.  Wished had all the connectors on the back instead of some on the side.Good picture and sound for the size of the unit.  Only drawback is the picture when viewing from the side is a little distorted but that is what you get with this kind of screen.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: Mounted this TV under a cabinet in the kitchen (purchased a separate hinged mount that folds). Watch it from our breakfast bar about 14' away. Nothing fancy but decent picture & sound. Exactly as we expected and quality good for the price. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: viewsonic tv
Reviews.Author: daroster "daroster"
Reviews.Content: The television set was delivered in good order as advertised.  I installed the television set, and this was quite simple following instructions.  I programmed the local stations.  I am well satisfied with the product.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, fair sound quality, good for the price
Reviews.Author: Timothy Banker
Reviews.Content: Needed a small TV to mount on the wall between two rooms so this fit well on a swivel mount. The picture is good for a small tv but viewing angle can be a bit restrictive. As noted the sound quality is a little tinny (Adjust the bass/treble to get better sound or use additional speakers). Channel setup is fairly simple and the remote works okay.

Reviews.Title: Straight on Eye level or no View
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I wanted a new TV for our kitchen to sit in the corner on our round kitchen table. We had had an old school 13 inch from 1997. Despite many good reviews, I was not impressed by this TV. I found that the picture was great when you were at eye level or little above the screen and straight on. However if you were to the side a little or lower than the screen then the picture sort of disappeared. The sound was not great either. It was very "tinny" even after manually adjusting the sound. It might be okay for use as a computer monitor but not as a TV, at least not for what I wanted a TV for. One that I can see from all seats of my round table and from the sink or stove. I am returning it. For $10 more I can get a Panasonic 19" LCD HDTV with 2 HDMI outputs dnd I tested out the "view" in person and its way better than this ViewSonic.

Reviews.Title: T.V=OK  Speakers = AWEFULL!!!!
Reviews.Author: Waldo
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife as a kitchen T.V.It works well enough. Not a very wide viewing angle and honestly the speakers flat out SUCK!!!Luckily I an extra pair of computer speakers to hook up but the headphone jack on the side which helped a TON.Wouldn't suggest for a main T.V but for a kitchen...sure why not.. after all....you are watching T.V in your kitchen.I cannot stress how awful the speakers actually are!! I didn't realize how fatiguing they were to my ears until hooking up external speakers.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Robert G Gregory
Reviews.Content: This TV is on our kitchen counter and it is a perfect fit.Some reviewers had concerns about the viewing angle, butfor our use its not a problem. This TV is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Lousy viewing angle and sound
Reviews.Author: Steve B.
Reviews.Content: This TV was mounted in a RV bedroom.  When laying down on the bed the TV picture was completely washed out.  The sound was bad as well.  Don't get this unless you can look straight at it!

Reviews.Title: ViewSonic 16
Reviews.Author: Albert B. Blackadar
Reviews.Content: cute little TV with excellent color viewability is a little sketchy on an angle.  Overall it is an excellent small bedroom unit.

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Video Quality
Reviews.Author: John Boenzi
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing HDTV.  Blacks are non-existent, with dark scenes turned into a gray soup.  The poorest off-axis viewing I've ever seen, both horizontal and vertical.  If you buy this set plan on sitting in a fixed spot, dead in front of it.  Also, there's a large power light right under the screen which cannot be dimmed or darkened, and which I found annoying.On the plus side it's a cute little set that fits perfectly in the niche I have for it.  However this is not enough to compensate for the poor video performance.  I will be returning the set for credit.

Reviews.Title: Great in the kitchen
Reviews.Author: Canda
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the reviewers in so much as the sound quality, or lack thereof, spoils this otherwise great little TV. We have ours mounted under the counter in the kitchen and it really does a great job on an antenna signal with a perfect picture. The TV sound quality is so poor we have the earphone out signal routed via the auxiliary input of a Bose radio and always use it that way. The computer monitor option is also useful for attaching a Netbook computer we have. The off angle viewing is a little weak but our regular viewing position presents no problem. For the $149 we paid it's a great value.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: Using in the kitchen for several years now. No issues.  I bought for the price, since quality in the kitchen was not the highest priority.

Reviews.Title: good deal for the money
Reviews.Author: JJC "Jim"
Reviews.Content: Fits very good in a kitchen or small area, sound is ok ,  Angle viewing for a small screen is ok.  for the cost you can not go wrong.Viewsonic has real people to talk to if you have problem. ,jjc pocono mountains of Pa

Reviews.Title: Very Suprised!
Reviews.Author: G. Weller
Reviews.Content: After reading other's reviews on this TV I was hesitant to purchase one. Boy was I suprised! I primarily use it as a second monitor for my Dell M11X via HDMI. Wow! The picture quality is way better that I expected. I would go so far as to say that it is better than my M11X's display. So much so that I use it as my primary monitor and the M11X's as the secondary. (ok, also because it is larger at 15.5" vs 11.6") The stand tilts which is nice since I use it elevated higher than my desk in one place, and on my desk in another. I chose this model in the first place because it is small enough to be portable(fits in my backpack), and it is only one of two in this size range with HDMI. The other one is not widescreen though. I like it so much that I bought two more for use in the other places that I work. (rendering the portability factor moot) I purchased them from an online retailer as refurbished so I paid only [...] each. ([...] shipped) You can't buy a PC monitor for that price. Other reviews complaining about the sound quality are not too far off base, but I would say "what do you expect from something so small?". The sound certainly is not a deal breaker for me. As far as the picture quality goes as a TV, that is great too. Especially for HD content. So if you are thinking about buying one of these for use as a second monitor I would definately say go for it, you'll be very satisfied. As a TV I would say yes for a kitchen or nightstand, but not if you have to be more than a few feet away from it.

Reviews.Title: comments on ViewSonic 16" TV
Reviews.Author: Alf "Alf"
Reviews.Content: Size and appearance are very nice in a limited space - we use in the kitchen.  Picture quality is fine and lcd is bright.  Two negatives are:  1) speakers have "tinny" sound, but one could add external speakers;  2) stand does not allow up/down-rotation of monitor so picture compromised if viewing at much of an angle.  Have cable so didn't try tuner. Overall satisfied with TV.

Reviews.Title: Very "tinny"
Reviews.Author: topgeek
Reviews.Content: Very small viewing angle both horizontally and vertically.  The sound is horrible. It is like hearing through a tin can.  Provided your head is perfectly centered in front of the screen, the color and brightness is great. Sadly, 2 degrees off in any direction and the screen "rainbows".

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Ira Solomon "Old Geek"
Reviews.Content: This is sitting next to my large PC screen (25").  The picture is quite good.  I have a 46" screen downstairs.  It is better, but this one is fine for the distance.  I connected it with HDMI to the cable box.  You will not get as good a picture if you use the other connections.  You can't get around that.  Sound will also be better with HDMI.If you move so you are looking at an off angle you may see some strange pictures.  This TV is not designed for  people looking at odd angles.Unpacking and connecting was very easy.  If you are in a place with a lot of WiFi or there is a cell tower or TV station near by, get a shielded HDMI cable.  They are not expensive these days.Another reason I picked this item was the ability to be used as a PC screen.  I don't expect my screen to drop any time soon, but things happen.If you want to set your cable remote to control the TV, look at the bottom of page 9 in the manual.  I tried following the Cable provider's manual (Comcast) and it failed.  The very first setting I tried from page 9 worked.I recommend this for an office or kitchen where a small TV is wanted.

Reviews.Title: limited viewing angle
Reviews.Author: Captain Pete
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small TV for the counter in the kitchen.  I had a Magnavox that I really liked but it crapped out in two years.  It is very hard to find anything in between 7" (too small) & 19" (too large).  I also did not want a built-in DVD, just the TV.  In general I like this TV, but most of the time if you try to look at the screen from too much of an angle you get dark patches on the picture.

Reviews.Title: Viewsonic N1630
Reviews.Author: Todd Catalano "WNYEMT628"
Reviews.Content: Nice unit - perfect for two preteens bedrooms!  Picture is a bit muted, but considering the price and the specs, I will say both of them, and myself, are pretty happy with the overall units. A nice buy you will not be disappointed with, but don't expect LED 3-D picture here..expect a value-priced unit at 720p, but a very well-functioning one.

Reviews.Title: only good watching straight on
Reviews.Author: TimNiego
Reviews.Content: We got this for the bedroom (it needed to be shorter than 14 inches for the dresser), but we have found unless you are sitting straight in front of the screen, it darkens and gets unwatchable even a few degrees off axis. It could be used as a computer monitor, I guess, when you only sit in front of it and are three feet away. The kids won't even watch tv in our room any more since they can't see it.

Reviews.Title: Works well for what i needed it for.
Reviews.Author: A. Gabriele "book girl"
Reviews.Content: First off the tuner is great, and brings in the hd channels crystal clear.  The only slight problem is the lag for them to come in and between channels...not as bad as some i seen, but not as good as others.  Overall a decent rate.  One thing i hate is the side coaxial connector, even with their little adapter isn't the best way to run the cable.  Also nice would be component outs (audio r/l and video).  As stated the audio is ok, but too much of the top end..i ran it through computer speakers so i don't have to hear it.  Overall a good model, wouldn't have bought anything else, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good value...
Reviews.Author: Jon G. Mclean
Reviews.Content: I bought this lcd last Christmas to be used in my bedroom. I have no complaints. The picture and sound are fine for late night viewing. The sleep timer is very convenient. I consider this a great value...

Reviews.Title: 15 inch viewsonic TV
Reviews.Author: Donavon Mcclard
Reviews.Content: Product has all the good attributes Viewsonic can display, exceptfor the sound. It is ideal small LCD TV that fits easily intoany room. It is fine for kitchen, where we planned to use it. Alas,the sound quality was intolerable and we returned the set.

Reviews.Title: Basic but does the job
Reviews.Author: J. Nauth
Reviews.Content: Bought this for our kitchen.  Nice size and decent picture.  The sound is not too good though, very tinny sounding.  Good TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: This is a nice small television
Reviews.Author: James R. Webb "Sunspower"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a small television with a nice picture, this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: G. Hanes
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is just right for the little office.  The picture is fantastic using over-the-air signals for the High Def.  While the sound is not a match for any bigger TV, the picture quality more than makes up for any sound deficiency.

Reviews.Title: Low cost TV
Reviews.Author: Old Gezzer "Geezer"
Reviews.Content: This TV has an excellent picture and is easy to set up and use. However it must be viewed front on or close to front on or picture fades dramatically. The sound is really, really awful. As a inexpensive TV for the kitchen it was a good choice. Once the warranty expires I will wire in a better speaker if the cat has not knocked it off the counter and destroyed it completely.

Reviews.Title: Awsome for the price...
Reviews.Author: A. Moore "Red Baren"
Reviews.Content: It's a perfect little monitor for traveling especially. I use it in the military for when I go alot of places for training. It has a pretty clear picture quality, great for gameing (X-Box, Play Station 3)Though the other reviews are true. The bigest and pretty much only down side is the built in speakers.... They are pretty cheap really crackly and loud.... Just have something playing on it like a movie or game and have the volume kinda loud then load settings and turn treble down and even the Bass down cause it crumbles..... But seriously the good weight out the Bad so don't let the sound problem stop you from getting one of these bad boys.....

Reviews.Title: View Sonic 16 Inch LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Patricia D. Keenan
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.  Excellent picture and very easy set up. I have nothing negative to say.  It is great. I bought this for my mother's kitchen and  she is very pleased. The sound is great, the picture is great and it is very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: View Sonic 16" TV
Reviews.Author: Russell P. Watters
Reviews.Content: The picture is great, the set is the right size for the kitchen, it is easy to operate.  The only bad thing is the sound is very tinny.  Have tried to adjust, but not any luck.  Other than that, a good set for a good price!

Reviews.Title: I would only recomend if it will be wall mounted
Reviews.Author: N. Moore "nikks976"
Reviews.Content: I got this product because i needed it for my dorm and it was a really good price. Its a bit too low and it cannot be adjusted but besdies that it's an ok product. I can't get any sound from my ps 2 on it so that's not good either.

Reviews.Title: Cheap LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas Josefsson
Reviews.Content: Flimsy plastic housing, extremely poor sound quality, limited viewing angle with poor picture quality even from the ideal viewing position, cheap
